title: Protocol Versioning Framework
abstract: This proposal introduces a comprehensive protocol versioning framework that enables systematic versioning of governance protocols, consensus mechanisms, and system interfaces while maintaining backward compatibility and enabling smooth protocol evolution.
motivation: The governance system requires systematic protocol versioning to enable evolution, maintain compatibility, and provide clear migration paths as the system grows and requirements change over time.
rationale: A comprehensive versioning framework enables controlled protocol evolution, maintains system stability during updates, and provides clear compatibility guarantees for all system components and integrations.
specification: Protocol versioning framework including systematic version management, backward compatibility mechanisms, migration path documentation, version negotiation protocols, and comprehensive compatibility testing.
benefits: Systematic protocol evolution with clear versioning
Backward compatibility ensuring system stability during updates
Clear migration paths for protocol upgrades
Comprehensive compatibility testing preventing integration issues
challenges: Complex version negotiation across distributed components
Maintaining backward compatibility while enabling innovation
Testing complexity for multiple protocol versions

consolidation.note: Infrastructure proposal for systematic protocol versioning
